title: E-commerce Returns and Delivery Integration Problem
desc_split: An online retailer operates multiple regional warehouses (`<loc_depot>`) to manage both outgoing deliveries and incoming returns. Trucks with `<capacity>` capacity must service `<num_customer>` locations (`<loc_customer>`), where some customers require deliveries (`<demand_linehaul>`) while others have returned items to pick up (`<demand_backhaul>`). The challenge is to design routes that allow flexible delivery-pickup sequences, ensuring no truck exceeds its capacity. The goal is to minimize total travel distance while balancing workload across depots and handling all customer requests efficiently.
label: mdvrpmb

The aim is to optimize routes to minimize fuel use while ensuring all bins are swapped and collected without overloading vehicles.
